div.h1:
Support for common
Java application setups
The JDO JPA Query Tool And Browser

div.div:
Vestigo is a query tool for the Java persistence frameworks JDO and JPA. It includes JDOQL and JPQL editors with syntax highlighting and auto-completion.
A result table shows the direct query results while the object tree browser allows searching the object graphs. Vestigo is available as Eclipse plug-in and standalone application for Windows, Linux and Mac.

ul.li: No manual joining of SQL-tables. Query your data and browse the results on object-level.
Flexible connection management including support for many application setups, Eclipse JDT integration as well as maven dependency support.
Support for various JDO and JPA implementations like EclipseLink, DataNucleus, Hibernate and OpenJPA.
JDOQL and JPQL query editors with syntax highlighting and auto-completion.
Well-structured browsing of query results in a result table or a tree view of the object graphs.
Listing of candidate classes in your persistence-unit or classpath with one-click query generation and execution.

td.p: Vestigo is currently distributed as version for early adopters.

This version has all the functionality of the final release. The user interface and project documentation, however, are still improved so these will change more often than within the normal update-cycle.
The pre-release version is distributed at a special promotion-price.

p.span: The pre-release offer ends on May 31.
